snippet: A "smog exchange" for Southern California in which polluting companies would buy credits from clean ones won preliminary approval tonight.   The 2,800-company exchange is intended to give businesses financial incentives to meet clean-air goals rat...
lead_paragraph: A "smog exchange" for Southern California in which polluting companies would buy credits from clean ones won preliminary approval tonight. The 2,800-company exchange is intended to give businesses financial incentives to meet clean-air goals rather than to order them to comply through specific regulations. The ultimate goal: to help clean the nation's dirtiest air.
